intro: Rufacer carolinianum, commonly known as the Carolina redshank, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. The plant is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, reddish-pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a reddish tinge, especially along the veins. Rufacer carolinianum typically grows in moist, disturbed soils in woodland edges and wetlands.
